The Real Leadership Lessons of Steve jobs

Six months after jobs's death, the author of his nest-selling biography identifies the every CEO can try to emulate. by Walter lsaacson

His saga is the enterpreneurial creation myth Write large: steve-jobs confounded Apple in his parent's garage in 1976, was ousted in 1985, returned to rescue it form near bankruptcy in along the way the time he died, in October 2011, had build it into the world's most valuable company. Along the way he helped to transform seven industries: personal computing, animated movies, music phones, table computing retail stores, and with Thomas Henry Ford, Henry Ford, and walt Disney. NOne of these men was a saint, but long after their personalities taer forgotten, history will how they applied imagination to technology and business.
